intro: Phyodina micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered phyodina, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, clustered umbels of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a distinctive, aromatic scent. Phyodina micrantha is often found in temperate regions of North America and is valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators.
